sen.j: 久美浜県（くみはまけん）は、1868年（慶応4年）に設置された県。
sen.e: Kumihama Prefecture is a prefecture established in 1868.
Kumihama Prefecture is a prefecture established in 1868.
Kumihama Prefecture was a prefecture established in 1868.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）、豊岡県に統合され消滅した。
sen.e: It was abolished and consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture in 1871.
It was abolished and consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture in 1871.
It was abolished and consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture in 1871.

sen.j: 丹後国、丹波国、但馬国、播磨国、美作国5ヶ国の久美浜代官所、生野奉行支配地および但馬、丹波の旗本領の926ヶ村23万石を管轄した。
sen.e: It had control over the Kumihama and Ikuno magistrate's office-dominated land in the five provinces of Tango, Tanba, Tajima, Harima and Mimasaka, and Hatamoto domain in Tajima and Tanba, which amounted to 926 villages and 230,000 koku.

It had control over the Kumihama and Ikuno magistrate's office-dominated land in the five provinces of Tango, Tanba, Tajima, Harima and Mimasaka, and Hatamoto domain in Tajima and Tanba, which amounted to 926 villages and 230,000 koku.

It had control over the Kumihama and Ikuno magistrate's office-dominated land in the five provinces of Tango, Tanba, Tajima, Harima and Mimasaka, and Hatamoto domain in Tajima and Tanba, which amounted to 926 villages and 230,000 koku.

sen.j: 県庁は旧久美浜代官所（京都府京丹後市）に置かれた。
sen.e: The prefectural government was located in the former Kumihama magistrate's office
The prefectural government was located in the former Kumihama magistrate's office.
The prefectural government was located in the former Kumihama magistrate's office (Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: （京都府京丹後市）→訳漏れのため訳出しました。

sen.j: 旧代官所は手狭であったことから、1870年（明治3年）に新庁舎が完成している。
sen.e: Since the former magistrate's office was too small, a government building was newly made in 1870.
Since the former magistrate's office was too small, a government building was newly made in 1870.
Since the former magistrate's office was too small, a government building was newly made in 1870.

sen.j: 生野代官所支配地を中心に分離運動が高まり、1869年（明治2年）、但馬（但馬北部の一部除く）、播磨、美作3ヶ国を生野県として分離した。
sen.e: As separatist movements was mounted in places dominated by the Ikuno magistrate's office, three Provinces of Tajima (except a part of northern Tajima), Harima and Mimasaka were separated from Kumihama Prefectufre and formed Ikuno Prefecture.

As separatist movements was mounted in places dominated by the Ikuno magistrate's office, three provinces of Tajima (except for a part of northern Tajima), Harima and Mimasaka were separated from Kumihama Prefecture and formed Ikuno Prefecture.

As separatist movements was mounted in places dominated by the Ikuno magistrate's office, three provinces of Tajima (except for a part of northern Tajima), Harima and Mimasaka were separated from Kumihama Prefecture and formed Ikuno Prefecture in 1869.
sen.cmt: 1869年（明治2年）→訳漏れのため訳出しました。

sen.j: また、但馬南部の一部を篠山藩へ移管している。
sen.e: A part of southern Tajima was transferred to the Sasayama Domain.
A part of southern Tajima was transferred to the Sasayama Domain.
A part of southern Tajima was transferred to the Sasayama Domain.

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）、府県統合により豊岡県に統合され消滅した。
sen.e: Kumihama Prefecture was abolished and consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.
Kumihama Prefecture was abolished and consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.
In 1871, Kumihama Prefecture was abolished and consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 1871年（明治4年）→訳漏れのため訳出しました。

sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1868年（慶応4年）4月19日 (旧暦)、旧生野代官支配地を統治する府中裁判所が設置
sen.e: On April 19, 1868 (old calendar), Fuchu Court was established to rule the land formaly dominated by the Ikuno magistrate's office.
On April 19, 1868 (old calendar), the Fuchu Court was established to rule the land formally dominated by the Ikuno magistrate's office.
May 11, 1868: The Fuchu Court was established to rule the land formally dominated by the Ikuno magistrate's office.
sen.cmt: 統一事項より、旧暦表記→新暦に修正「年月日: 」形式に変更

sen.j: 1868年（慶応4年）閏4月28日 (旧暦)、旧久美浜支配地を統括する久美浜県が発足
sen.e: On April 28, 1868 (old calendar), Kumihama Prefecture was established to rule the former Kumihama dominated area.
On April 28, 1868 (old calendar), Kumihama Prefecture was established to rule the former Kumihama dominated area.
June 18, 1868: Kumihama Prefecture was established to rule the former Kumihama dominated area.
sen.cmt: 統一事項より、旧暦表記→新暦に修正「年月日: 」形式に変更

sen.j: 1868年（慶応4年）7月29日 (旧暦)、府中裁判所が廃止され、久美浜県に編入（23万石）
sen.e: On July 29, 1868 (old calendar), Fuchu Court was abolished and incorporated into Kumihama Prefecture (? koku).
On July 29, 1868 (old calendar), the Fuchu Court was abolished and incorporated into Kumihama Prefecture (? koku).
September 15, 1868: The Fuchu Court was abolished and incorporated into Kumihama Prefecture (230,000 koku).
sen.cmt: 統一事項より、旧暦表記→新暦に修正、? Koku→230,000 kokuに修正「年月日: 」形式に変更

sen.j: 1869年（明治2年）8月10日 (旧暦)、但馬、播磨、美作を生野県として分離、但馬南部の一部を篠山藩へ移管
sen.e: On August 10, 1869 (old calendar), Tajima, Harima and Mimasaka was separated and formed Ikuno Prefecture, and a part of southern Tajima was transferred to Sasayama Domain.
On August 10, 1869 (old calendar), Tajima, Harima and Mimasaka were separated and formed Ikuno Prefecture, and a part of southern Tajima was transferred to Sasayama Domain.
September 15, 1869: Tajima, Harima and Mimasaka were separated and formed Ikuno Prefecture, and a part of southern Tajima was transferred to Sasayama Domain.
sen.cmt: 統一事項より、旧暦表記→新暦に修正「年月日: 」形式に変更

sen.j: 1870年（明治3年）5月5日 (旧暦)、新庁舎完成
sen.e: On May 5, 1870, the new government building was completed.
On May 5, 1870, the new government building was completed.
June 3, 1870: The new government building was completed.
sen.cmt: 統一事項より、旧暦表記→新暦に修正「年月日: 」形式に変更

sen.j: 1871年（明治4年）11月2日 (旧暦)、豊岡県に統合
sen.e: On November 2, 1871 (old calendar), it was consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.
On November 2, 1871 (old calendar), it was consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.
December 13, 1871: It was consolidated into Toyooka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 統一事項より、旧暦表記→新暦に修正「年月日: 」形式に変更
